course.title: Planners, Experts, and Bureaucrats: Seminar
course.description: How is state authority and control achieved? What kinds of knowledge, objects, spaces, and practices do state bureaucracies mobilize? In this course we will read recent ethnographic and historical works on state planning, expertise, and bureaucracy. The course aims to build a nuanced account of the workings of state bureaucracies and the everyday processes through which they exercise power. We will examine the wide array of agents, artifacts, and practices that are at the core of state action. Topics include bureaucratic materiality, documentary practices, planning technologies, development, environmental policies, and architecture and design, among others.
